pageContext.claim: “In 2016, an officer was assaulted in America on an average of every 10 minutes.”
pageContext.analysis: According to FBI data, an officer was assaulted roughly every 9 minutes in 2016. When adjusted for agencies that didn't report data, the math works out. However, this metric counts a shove and a stabbing — two very different acts — as equal. According to an analysis by PolitiFact, only 28.9 percent of these assaults resulted in injuries and a firearm or knife was used in just over five percent. Trump is skating a fine line. His math checks out, but the context how he is presenting "assault" is misleading.
